title: May's story
subject_group: Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Memory
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Australians - Relations with Japanese
Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Children - Japan - Social life and customs
Family, Gender Identity, Relationships & Sexuality/Teacher-student relationships
abstract: 'A woman of great kindness and determination.'
description: In 1895, at the age of 24, May sailed to Japan and dedicated her life to caring for the children in the villages. Sue Freeth, with the help of some of May's ex-students, traces the path walked by May, and in doing so comes closer to understanding the life of this amazing woman.
part_of_compliation_title_or_vod_package: Compilation title; B2002303; Digital Storytelling workshop : general public (March 2009); Active; 2009
